original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Su­bhūti?

original: sems can 'di dag yun ring po nas ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la spyod spyod pa yin snyam mam /🔽rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag yun ring po nas ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la spyod spyod pa yin snyam mam / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” The venerable Su­bhūti replied, “Blessed One!

original: de de lta lags so //
analyzed: de de lta lags so //
translated: Indeed, it is so!

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Well-Gone One!

original: de de lta lags te /
analyzed: de de lta lags te /
translated: Indeed, it is so!

original: sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings

original: yun ring po nas ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la spyod spyod pa lags so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: yun ring po nas ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la spyod spyod pa lags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dag dben pa yin zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems / ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dag dben pa yin zhing /
translated: ” The Blessed One said, “What do you think, Su­bhūti?🔽Are the apprehension of an ‘I’ and the apprehension of ‘mine’ void?

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dag stong pa yin snyam mam /🔽rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dag stong pa yin snyam mam / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Are the apprehension of an ‘I’ and the apprehension of ‘mine’ empty?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” The venerable Su­bhūti replied, “Blessed One!

original: dben pa lags so //
analyzed: dben pa lags so //
translated: Indeed, they are void!

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Sugata,

original: stong pa lags so //
analyzed: stong pa lags so //
translated: it is empty.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i sems can rnams 'phyan zhing 'khor snyam mam /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i sems can rnams 'phyan zhing 'khor snyam mam /
translated: Do beings who have the thought of ‘I’ and ‘mine’ wander and transmigrate?”

original: @353a *// rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: @353a *// rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de de lta lags so //
analyzed: de de lta lags so //
translated: it is so.

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Sugata,

original: de de lta lags te /
analyzed: de de lta lags te /
translated: it is so.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i sems can rnams 'phyan zhing 'khor lags so //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i sems can rnams 'phyan zhing 'khor lags so //
translated: Beings who have the thought of ‘I’ and ‘mine’ wander and transmigrate.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /

analyzed: 'khor ba na 'khor zhing 'phyan pa'i sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang yod pa yin no //
translated: thus, the afflictions of beings who wander and transmigrate in saṃsāra exist.

original: rab 'byor / gang la ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med pa de la 'dzin pa med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang la ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med pa de la 'dzin pa med de /

original: sems can de dag ni /
analyzed: sems can de dag ni /
translated: Those beings

original: 'khor bar mi 'phyan zhing mi 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'khor bar mi 'phyan zhing mi 'khor ro //

original: gang la 'khor bar 'phyan pa med pa dang / 'khor ba med pa de la kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: gang la 'khor bar 'phyan pa med pa dang / 'khor ba med pa de la kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Where there is no wandering in saṃsāra, there is no affliction.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /

analyzed: rnam par byang ba'ang yod pa yin no //

analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi spyod lags so //

analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi bar la mi spyod lags so //

analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i bar la mi spyod lags so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

translated: and they rejoice in it.

original: de dag dga' ba chen po mngon par sgrub par byed kyang de dag mtshan ma de dang lhan cig mi gnas pa de dag btang snyoms chen po thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dga' ba chen po mngon par sgrub par byed kyang de dag mtshan ma de dang lhan cig mi gnas pa de dag btang snyoms chen po thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They accomplish great joy, but they do not abide with those signs, and they attain great equanimity.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni /
translated: Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi snang ba chen po yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi snang ba chen po yin te /
translated: this is the great illumination of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: 'di @355b lta ste; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba dang / bsam gtan dang / brtson 'grus dang / bzod pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba yin no;/
analyzed: 'di @355b lta ste; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba dang / bsam gtan dang / brtson 'grus dang / bzod pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba yin no;/
translated: It is the illumination of the perfection of wisdom, and it is the illumination of the perfections of meditative concentration, perseverance, patience, ethical discipline, and generosity.

original: rigs kyi bu de dag ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de dag ni /
translated: Noble son,

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyang sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa'ang yin la /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyang sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa'ang yin la /
translated: even though they have not attained manifest, complete buddhahood, they are worthy of the offerings of all sentient beings,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las kyang phyir mi ldog go /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las kyang phyir mi ldog go /
translated: and they will not turn back from unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: gang gis gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad dag yongs su spyad na /
analyzed: gang gis gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad dag yongs su spyad na /
translated: Those who make use of the robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, medicines for illness, and other necessities

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas gnas la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas gnas la /
translated: should do so while maintaining the mental activity associated with the perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa po dang / sbyin pa dag rnams kyi sbyin pa de dag yongs su sbyong zhing /
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang / sbyin pa dag rnams kyi sbyin pa de dag yongs su sbyong zhing /
translated: They should purify the generosity of those donors and recipients

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar gyur pas na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar gyur pas na /
translated: and they will also be close to the knowledge of all modes.

original: de'i yo byad de dag ni /
analyzed: de'i yo byad de dag ni /
translated: Those who have these requisites

original: 'bras bu che ba dang / phan yon che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba dang / phan yon che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will have great fruit and great benefit.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore, Subhuti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms 'bras bu yod par spyod par 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad la lam nye bar ston par 'dod pa dang / snang ba chen po byed par 'dod pa dang / sems can bcings par gyur pa rnams yongs su dgrol bar 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms 'bras bu yod par spyod par 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad la lam nye bar ston par 'dod pa dang / snang ba chen po byed par 'dod pa dang / sems can bcings par gyur pa rnams yongs su dgrol bar 'dod pa dang /
translated: the Bodhisattva, the great being, who wants to enjoy the gifts of a village or town as a reward, who wants to show the path to all beings, who wants to make a great light shine, who wants to liberate all beings who are bound,

original: sems can thams cad la bla na med pa'i shes rab kyi mig nye bar ston par @356a *//🔽'dod pa ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bla na med pa'i shes rab kyi mig nye bar ston par @356a *// 'dod pa ni /
translated: who wants to show the unsurpassed eye of wisdom to all beings,🔽he should stand in the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis gnas par bya'o //
translated: with attentions associated with the knowledge of all modes.

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa de dag gis yid la byed cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa de dag gis yid la byed cing /
translated: Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings, with those mental attentions associated with the perfection of wisdom, pay attention to the perfection of wisdom,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa de dag gis yid la byed na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa de dag gis yid la byed na /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings, with those mental attentions associated with the perfection of wisdom, pay attention to the perfection of wisdom,

original: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi gtam yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi gtam yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: they should also speak about the very subject of the perfection of wisdom.

original: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi gtam brjod nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi yid la byed pa dag yid la bya'o //
analyzed: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi gtam brjod nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi yid la byed pa dag yid la bya'o //
translated: Having spoken about the very subject of the perfection of wisdom, they should also pay attention to the mental attentions associated with the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis yid la byed pas gnas pa des yid la byed pa gzhan dag gis go skabs mi dbye bar ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa de dag
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis yid la byed pas gnas pa des yid la byed pa gzhan dag gis go skabs mi dbye bar ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa de dag
translated: “Subhūti, that bodhisattva great being should not give an opportunity to other attentional foci while remaining in that attention that is conjoined with the perfection of wisdom.

original: gis brtson pa mi gtang bar nyin mtshan du gnas par byed pa de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: gis brtson pa mi gtang bar nyin mtshan du gnas par byed pa de ltar bya'o //
translated: He should not give up his effort, but should remain day and night in that attention that is conjoined with the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / sngon chad nor bu rin po che rnyed ma myong ba'i mi zhig yod la; des dus gzhan zhig na nor bu rin po che rnyed par gyur te /
analyzed: dper na / sngon chad nor bu rin po che rnyed ma myong ba'i mi zhig yod la; des dus gzhan zhig na nor bu rin po che rnyed par gyur te /
translated: Suppose there were a person who had never before obtained a precious jewel, and then at another time he obtained a precious jewel.

original: des nor bu rin po che rnyed pas dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / yid bde ba rgya chen po dang ldan par @356b gyur pa las /
analyzed: des nor bu rin po che rnyed pas dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / yid bde ba rgya chen po dang ldan par @356b gyur pa las /
translated: He would be filled with joy, supreme joy, and vast mental satisfaction because he had obtained the precious jewel.

original: des nor bu rin po che de rnyed ma thag tu stor bar gyur na /
analyzed: des nor bu rin po che de rnyed ma thag tu stor bar gyur na /
translated: But as soon as he had obtained that precious jewel, he lost it.

original: de gzhi de las sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba chen po dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gzhi de las sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba chen po dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: and he will be greatly afflicted and unhappy.

original: de rtag tu rgyun mi chad par ae ma'o kye hud bdag ni /
analyzed: de rtag tu rgyun mi chad par ae ma'o kye hud bdag ni /
translated: He will constantly and always think, ‘Alas!

original: nor bu rin po che de dang bral bar gyur to //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che de dang bral bar gyur to //
translated: I have been separated from that precious gem!’

original: snyam du nor bu rin po che dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa sha stag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snyam du nor bu rin po che dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa sha stag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and he will constantly think about the precious gem.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang 'di ni /🔽rin po che yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang 'di ni / rin po che yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, bodhisattva great beings should think,

original: snyam du bsam zhing /
analyzed: snyam du bsam zhing /
translated: ‘This is a precious gem!’

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag dang mi 'bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag dang mi 'bral bar bya'o //
translated: and they should not be separated from the attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: yid la bgyid pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: yid la bgyid pa thams cad ni /
translated: all attention

original: rang bzhin dang bral ba lags la /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bral ba lags la /
translated: is free from intrinsic nature,

original: yid la bgyid pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: yid la bgyid pa thams cad ni /
translated: and all attention

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
translated: If they are empty of an intrinsic nature,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bgyid pa dag dang ma bral bar gyur pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bgyid pa dag dang ma bral bar gyur pa lags /
translated: how can bodhisattva great beings be inseparable from the mental activity associated with the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bral ba la ni /
analyzed: bral ba la ni /
translated: In separation,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / yid la bgyid pa dag dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang dmigs su ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / yid la bgyid pa dag dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang dmigs su ma mchis pa lags /
translated: the bodhisattvas, the mental activity, and the knowledge of all aspects are not apprehended.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems @357a *//
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems @357a *//
translated: Venerable Subhūti having thus requested, the Blessed One said to him,

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar /
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar /
translated: “Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings think,

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /
translated: ‘All phenomena

original: rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
translated: are devoid of an intrinsic nature,

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: they are not

original: nyan thos rnams kyis ma byas /🔽rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma byas /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis ma byas / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma byas /
translated: created by the hearers,🔽not created by the solitary buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang ma mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang ma mdzad de /
translated: and not created by the blessed buddhas,

original: chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor pa de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor pa de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ni /
translated: and the very limit of reality

original: gnas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa nyid yin no //
translated: are the very state of being.

original: zhes bya bar shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: zhes bya bar shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who know this

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba yin no //
translated: are not separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar /
translated: Subhūti, it is because

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom

original: rang bzhin gyis dben zhing rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pas na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dben zhing rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pas na /
translated: is empty of a basic nature,

original: de la rnam par 'phel ba med cing yongs su 'grib pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rnam par 'phel ba med cing yongs su 'grib pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and it does not increase or decrease.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti then asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis dben zhing rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis dben zhing rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
translated: if the perfection of wisdom is empty of a basic nature,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par bsgrubs par bgyis shing /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par bsgrubs par bgyis shing /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings, having practiced the perfection of wisdom,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags /
translated: fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @357b pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bsgrubs kyang rnam par 'phel ba 'am yongs su 'grib pa med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @357b pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bsgrubs kyang rnam par 'phel ba 'am yongs su 'grib pa med de /
translated: “Su­bhūti, although bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, there is no increase or decrease,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la'ang rnam par 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med la chos kyi dbyings la'ang rnam par 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la'ang rnam par 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med la chos kyi dbyings la'ang rnam par 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med do //
translated: and there is no increase or decrease in the finality of existence, nor is there any increase or decrease in the expanse of reality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: it is because the perfection of wisdom

original: gcig kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: gcig kyang ma yin la /
translated: is not one thing,🔽and

original: gnyis kyang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is neither of the two.

original: rab 'byor / gal te de ltar bstan pa na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi zhum /🔽mi 'gong / mi skrag /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te de ltar bstan pa na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi zhum / mi 'gong / mi skrag /
translated: Subhūti, if, when this is taught, the mind of a bodhisattva great being does not become cowed,🔽does not tense up, does not tremble, does not shiver,

original: mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: does not become frightened,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
translated: then that bodhisattva great being

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas shing mtha' thug par 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas shing mtha' thug par 'gro ba yin te /
translated: is standing on the irreversible level and is going from stage to stage.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
translated: That bodhisattva great being

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid dang / gsog nyid dang / gsob nyid dang / ya ma brla nyid dang / snying po ma mchis pa gang lags pa de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid dang / gsog nyid dang / gsob nyid dang / ya ma brla nyid dang / snying po ma mchis pa gang lags pa de /
translated: is it that emptiness, hollowness, falsity, sham, and essencelessness of the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod lags sam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod lags sam /
translated: is practicing the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: it is not.🔽”

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i chos 'ga' yang dmigs su mchis lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i chos 'ga' yang dmigs su mchis lags sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Blessed One, is a phenomenon that is separate from the perfection of wisdom observed that practices the perfection of wisdom?🔽”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / @358a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / @358a *//
translated: “Subhūti,🔽it is not.

original: de ni / ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni / ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.🔽

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod lags sam / bka' stsal pa //
translated: “Blessed One, does the perfection of wisdom practice the perfection of wisdom?🔽”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: ma yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: it is not.🔽”🔽Subhūti said,

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod lags sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Blessed One, does emptiness practice emptiness?🔽”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: it is not.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma lags pa /
translated: not something in the domain of sophistry,

original: zhib mor brtag pa'i mkhas pa dang / mdzangs pas rig par bgyi ba'i bar dag lags te /
analyzed: zhib mor brtag pa'i mkhas pa dang / mdzangs pas rig par bgyi ba'i bar dag lags te /
translated: up to something to be known by the wise, the astute, the very astute, the skilled, and the clever.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par bgyid cing /
analyzed: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par bgyid cing /
translated: those who listen to this deep perfection of wisdom, take it up, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, and practice it as it has been taught,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan dag gis skabs mi 'byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan dag gis skabs mi 'byed pa de dag ni /
translated: and until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they do not let other thoughts and thought-related phenomena interrupt them.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ngan don dang ldan pa ma lags so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ngan don dang ldan pa ma lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, those who have wholesome roots are not of meager significance.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: koo shi ka /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Kauśika,🔽it is so,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is just so.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

analyzed: @361a *// gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed cing /
translated: those who listen to this deep perfection of wisdom, take it up, read it aloud, master it, and practice it as it has been taught,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan dag gi skabs mi 'byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan dag gi skabs mi 'byed pa de dag ni /

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ngan ngon dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ngan ngon dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: they do not have a small amount of wholesome roots.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /

original: dzambu'i gling gi sems can gang dag ji snyed pa de dag thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang ldan par gyur cing /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling gi sems can gang dag ji snyed pa de dag thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang ldan par gyur cing /
translated: If all the beings in Jambudvīpa were endowed with the ten wholesome courses of action,

analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang ldan par gyur la /
translated: and were endowed with the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions,

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: and if some son of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed la /

original: bzung zhing bcangs la bklags shing kun chub par byas nas kyang de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed na /
analyzed: bzung zhing bcangs la bklags shing kun chub par byas nas kyang de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed na /

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de la dge ba'i rtsa ba snga ma des ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de la dge ba'i rtsa ba snga ma des ni /
translated: compared to the wholesome roots of those beings, those wholesome roots

original: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: are not even a hundredth part,

original: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba phrag 'bum gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba phrag 'bum gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not approach even a fraction, a hundredth part, a thousandth part, or a hundred thousandth part of that.

original: grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not approach even a count, a fraction, a comparison, or a simile of that.

original: de nas dge slong zhig gis lha'i dbang bo brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas dge slong zhig gis lha'i dbang bo brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then a certain monk said to Śatakratu, head of the gods:

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: @361b rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: @361b rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: if sons of a good family or daughters of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag g-yeng ba med pa'i sems kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang zhing klog la kun chub par byed pa dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed cing /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag g-yeng ba med pa'i sems kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang zhing klog la kun chub par byed pa dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed cing /
translated: who are not distracted in mind take up this deep perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, and practice it as it has been taught,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan dag gi skabs mi 'byed pa de dag gis ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan dag gi skabs mi 'byed pa de dag gis ni /
translated: and until they fully and completely awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening do not give other dharmas and other dharmas that arise from mind an opportunity,

original: dzambu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang ldan par gyur pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang ldan pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang ldan par gyur pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang ldan pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang /
translated: The beings of Jambudvīpa are endowed with the path of the ten virtuous actions, endowed with the four concentrations, endowed with the four immeasurables, endowed with the four formless absorptions,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa de dag zil gyis non pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa de dag zil gyis non pa yin no //
translated: and endowed with the five superknowledges.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis dge slong de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis dge slong de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the bhikṣu,

original: dge slong / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems bskyed pa gcig gis kyang dzambu'i gling gi sems can dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang ldan pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang ldan pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems bskyed pa gcig gis kyang dzambu'i gling gi sems can dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang ldan pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang ldan pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang /
translated: “Bhikṣu, the bodhisattva mahāsattva surpasses the merit from a single generation of the mind that is possessed by the beings of Jambudvīpa who are endowed with the path of the ten virtuous actions, endowed with the four concentrations, endowed with the four immeasurables,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa de dag zil gyis non na /🔽gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / bzung zhing bcangs la bklags @362a *//
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa de dag zil gyis non na / gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / bzung zhing bcangs la bklags @362a *//
translated: and the four formless absorptions, and the five kinds of superknowledge,

original: shing kun chub par byas nas kyang de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed pa dag gis lta smos kyang ci dgos te /🔽lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis non par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: shing kun chub par byas nas kyang de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed pa dag gis lta smos kyang ci dgos te / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis non par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
translated: what need is there to speak of those who take up this deep perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite and study it, and master it, and having mastered it, also practice it?🔽Those bodhisattva great beings who practice this deep perfection of wisdom will outshine the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who practice this deep perfection of wisdom will outshine the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.”🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten nyi tshe zil gyis non par 'gyur ba'ang ma zad de /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /🔽rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten nyi tshe zil gyis non par 'gyur ba'ang ma zad de / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Not only does the bodhisattva mahāsattva outshine the world with its gods, humans, and asuras,🔽but also, Śāriputra,🔽the bodhisattva mahāsattva outshines all the stream enterers, once-returners, non-returners, arhats, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bar dag nyi tsher yang ma zad de /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bar dag nyi tsher yang ma zad de / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
translated: “Not only does the bodhisattva mahāsattva outshine the stream enterers, once-returners, non-returners, arhats, and pratyekabuddhas,🔽but also, Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pa dang mi ldan zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pa dang mi ldan zhing /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva outshines all the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice the perfection of generosity without skill in means,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba de dag thams cad kyang zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba de dag thams cad kyang zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
translated: All those who are without the perfection of wisdom are outshone.

original: gang dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag nyi tsher yang ma zad de /
analyzed: gang dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag nyi tsher yang ma zad de /
translated: Not only those who practice the perfection of generosity,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
translated: but also the bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: byang chub sems dpa' @362b sems dpa' chen po gang dag tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pa dang mi ldan zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @362b sems dpa' chen po gang dag tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pa dang mi ldan zhing /
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice the perfection of morality but are not skilled in means

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba de dag kyang zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba de dag kyang zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
translated: and are without the perfection of wisdom are outshone.

original: gang dag tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag nyi tsher yang ma zad de /
analyzed: gang dag tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag nyi tsher yang ma zad de /
translated: Not only those who practice the perfection of morality,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
translated: but also the bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pa dang mi ldan zhing /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba dag kyang zil gyis non par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pa dang mi ldan zhing / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba dag kyang zil gyis non par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, and the perfection of concentration, but who are not skilled in means and are devoid of the perfection of wisdom, will be surpassed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag ni /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught will not be surpassed

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis zil gyis non par mi nus so //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis zil gyis non par mi nus so // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.🔽The bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught

original: ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ste /
translated: are following the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gdung rgyun mi chad par byed par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gdung rgyun mi chad par byed par gnas pa yin no //
translated: are the ones who are the unbroken lineage of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ring du mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ring du mi byed pa yin no //
translated: are the ones who do not make the Tathāgata distant.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar sgrub @363a *//🔽pa de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar sgrub @363a *// pa de dag ni /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who practice like that

original: byang chub kyi snying po las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: are the ones who do not turn back from the site of awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings

original: sems can bying ba rnams 'don par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can bying ba rnams 'don par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: are the ones who want to rescue beings who are sinking.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa de dag ni /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who train like that

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob pa ste /
translated: are the ones who train in the bodhisattva training.

original: nyan thos kyi bslab pa la slob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi bslab pa la slob pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not training in the śrāvaka training.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi bslab pa la slob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi bslab pa la slob pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not training in the pratyekabuddha training.

original: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag kyang 'gro bar sems shing /
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag kyang 'gro bar sems shing /
translated: The four great kings will think to approach the bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains in that way.

original: 'ongs nas kyang 'di skad du; skyen par slobs shig /
analyzed: 'ongs nas kyang 'di skad du; skyen par slobs shig /
translated: Having approached, they will say, ‘Study quickly!

original: myur du slobs shig /
analyzed: myur du slobs shig /
translated: Study swiftly!

original: lhung bzed bzhi po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed bzhi po 'di dag ni /
translated: These four alms bowls

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang bzhes pa yin pas /
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang bzhes pa yin pas /
translated: were used by the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas of the past.

original: khyod byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang blang bar bya ba yin no //🔽zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang blang bar bya ba yin no //🔽zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: You should take them up when you are seated at the seat of awakening and have fully awakened to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i drung du rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag kyang rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i drung du rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag kyang rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
translated: The four great kings also think that they should go into the presence of the bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom in that way, together with the sons of the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm.

original: kho bo'ang sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //🔽lha'i bu rab 'thab bral yang 'thab bral ba'i lha'i bu @363b rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
analyzed: kho bo'ang sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so // lha'i bu rab 'thab bral yang 'thab bral ba'i lha'i bu @363b rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
translated: I also think that I should go, together with the sons of the gods of the Trāyastriṃśa realm.🔽The son of the gods Suyāma also thinks that he should go, together with the sons of the gods of the Yāma realm.

original: lha'i bu yongs su dga' ldan yang dga' ldan gyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
analyzed: lha'i bu yongs su dga' ldan yang dga' ldan gyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
translated: The son of the gods Saṃtuṣita also thinks that he should go, together with the sons of the gods of the Tuṣita realm.

original: de bzhin du lha'i bu rab 'phrul dga' dang / lha'i bu dbang sgyur dang / mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa'ang tshangs ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha'i bu rab 'phrul dga' dang / lha'i bu dbang sgyur dang / mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa'ang tshangs ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
translated: Similarly, the son of the gods Sunirmita, the son of the gods Vaśavartin, and Brahmā, lord of the Sahā world, also think that they should go, together with the sons of the gods of the Brahmakāyika realm.

original: de bzhin du lha'i bu 'od gsal yang 'od gsal gyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha'i bu 'od gsal yang 'od gsal gyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
translated: In the same way, the god Ābhāsvara thinks, ‘I will go together with the gods of Ābhāsvara.’

original: de bzhin du dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che dang / mi che dang / mi gdung dang / shin tu mthong dang / gya nom snang dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams kyang 'gro bar sems so //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de la ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che dang / mi che dang / mi gdung dang / shin tu mthong dang / gya nom snang dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams kyang 'gro bar sems so // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de la ni /
translated: In the same way, the gods of Śubhakṛtsna, Bṛhatphala, Avṛha, Atapa, Sudarśana, Sudṛśa, and up to Akaniṣṭha think, ‘I will go.’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang rtag tu dgongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang rtag tu dgongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones always pay attention to those bodhisattva great beings who practice this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de'i lus la ni; 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba gang ji snyed cig lus la 'byung bar 'gyur ba de
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de'i lus la ni; 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba gang ji snyed cig lus la 'byung bar 'gyur ba de
translated: They will not experience any of them in any way at all.🔽“Bhikṣus,🔽these are the qualities in this life of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.🔽“Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom will not experience any of the other worldly sufferings that might arise in their bodies.🔽They will not experience any of them at all.🔽They will not experience any of them in any way at all.

original: dag kyang thams cad kyi thams cad /
analyzed: dag kyang thams cad kyi thams cad /
translated: “Bhikṣus,🔽these are the qualities in this life of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.🔽“Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom will not experience any of the other worldly sufferings that might arise in their bodies.🔽They will not experience any of them at all.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not experience any of them in any way at all.

original: dge slong / 'di ni /
analyzed: dge slong / 'di ni /
translated: “Bhikṣus,🔽these are the qualities in this life of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de'i tshe 'di'i yon tan yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de'i tshe 'di'i yon tan yin no //
translated: “Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom will not experience any of the other worldly sufferings that might arise in their bodies.

original: de'i lus @364a *//
analyzed: de'i lus @364a *//
translated: They will not experience any of them at all.🔽They will not experience any of them in any way at all.🔽“Bhikṣus,

original: la 'dus pa las gyur pa'i nad gang ji snyed pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: la 'dus pa las gyur pa'i nad gang ji snyed pa 'di lta ste /
translated: these are the qualities in this life of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.🔽“Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom will not experience any of the other worldly sufferings that might arise in their bodies.

original: mig nad dang / rna ba'i nad dang / sna nad dang / lce nad dang / so nad dang / lus kyi nad dang / sems kyi nad gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig nad dang / rna ba'i nad dang / sna nad dang / lce nad dang / so nad dang / lus kyi nad dang / sems kyi nad gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: All eye diseases, ear diseases, nose diseases, tongue diseases, tooth diseases, body diseases, and mental diseases will not occur.

original: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe 'di'i yon tan du shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe 'di'i yon tan du shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: This is also to be known as the good qualities of this [practice] when a bodhisattva mahāsattva practices this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo 'di snyam du sems te /🔽ci / lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di rang gi spobs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston tam /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo 'di snyam du sems te / ci / lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di rang gi spobs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston tam /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda thought this:🔽Is this Śakra, Lord of the Gods, teaching the perfection of wisdom through his own eloquence,

original: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi sa mthus ston snyam mo //
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi sa mthus ston snyam mo //
translated: or is he teaching through the Buddha's power?

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo'i sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo'i sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, knowing in his mind the thoughts occurring to the venerable Ānanda, said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: btsun pa kun dga' bo /
analyzed: btsun pa kun dga' bo /
translated: “Venerable Ānanda,

original: 'di ltar / kho bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar / kho bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa 'di ni /
translated: you should know that this demonstration of the perfection of wisdom by me

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: is the power of the Buddha.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽kun dga' bo /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // kun dga' bo / de de bzhin no //
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: de de bzhin te /🔽'di ltar / lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de ni /
analyzed: de de bzhin te / 'di ltar / lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de ni /
translated: “So it is, Ānanda, so it is!🔽It is just as Śatakratu, head of the gods, has said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu yin no //
translated: ‘This demonstration of the perfection of wisdom by me is the power of the Tathāgata.

original: de ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yin no //
analyzed: de ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yin no //
translated: It is the Tathāgata’s authorization.’🔽Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' @364b sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgom pa de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bdud sdig can de dag thams cad 'di snyam du /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' @364b sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgom pa de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bdud sdig can de dag thams cad 'di snyam du /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom, practice the perfection of wisdom, and cultivate the perfection of wisdom, then all the Māras in the worlds of the great trichiliocosm think,

original: ci / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ci / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: ‘Will this bodhisattva great being actualize the very limit of reality?

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byas nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byas nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ram /
translated: Having actualized the very limit of reality, will he actualize the result of stream enterer?

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: Or the result of once-returner?

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /🔽dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am / dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ram /
translated: Or the result of non-returner?🔽Or the state of a worthy one?

original: rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ram /
translated: Or will he attain a pratyekabuddha’s awakening?

original: 'on te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur snyam du the tshom skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur snyam du the tshom skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or will they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?’

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe bdud sdig can mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe bdud sdig can mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug par 'gyur ro //
translated: when bodhisattva great beings are separated from the perfection of wisdom, then wicked Māra is pained by the anguish of sorrow.

original: kun dga' bo /🔽gzhan yang bdud sdig can gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spa bkong bar bya ba dang / spu zing zhes byed par 'gyur ba dang / sems zhum par 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig tsam yang rnam par g-yeng bar bya ba'i phyir skar mda' gtong @365a *//
analyzed: kun dga' bo / gzhan yang bdud sdig can gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spa bkong bar bya ba dang / spu zing zhes byed par 'gyur ba dang / sems zhum par 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig tsam yang rnam par g-yeng bar bya ba'i phyir skar mda' gtong @365a *//
translated: Ānanda,

original: zhing 'jigs pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: zhing 'jigs pa skyed par byed do //
translated: further, wicked Māra will make the hair of the bodhisattva great beings stand on end, will make their hair bristle, will make their minds depressed, and will send down meteors to frighten them, to distract them even from just one thought of arousing the mind to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyi drung du bdud sdig can mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas mchi bar 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: ci / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyi drung du bdud sdig can mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas mchi bar 'gyur lags sam /
translated: will the evil Māra come to all bodhisattva great beings with the intention to harm?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyi drung du bdud sdig can mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas 'ong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyi drung du bdud sdig can mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas 'ong ba ma yin te /
translated: the evil Māra does not come to all bodhisattva great beings with the intention to harm.

original: kun dga' bo /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kha cig gi drung du ni /
analyzed: kun dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kha cig gi drung du ni /
translated: Ānanda,

original: bdud sdig can mtho 'tsham pas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //🔽kha cig gi drung du ni /
analyzed: bdud sdig can mtho 'tsham pas 'ong bar 'gyur ro // kha cig gi drung du ni /
translated: the evil Māra comes to some bodhisattva great beings with the intention to harm.

original: 'ong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: To some he does not come.

original: kun dga' bos gsol pa /
analyzed: kun dga' bos gsol pa /
translated: Ānanda said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji lta bu dag gi drung du bdud sdig can mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas mchi bar 'gyur la /🔽ji lta bu dag gi drung du ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji lta bu dag gi drung du bdud sdig can mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas mchi bar 'gyur la / ji lta bu dag gi drung du ni /
translated: “What kind of bodhisattva great beings does Māra, the evil one, approach with the intention to harm?

original: mchi bar mi 'gyur lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mchi bar mi 'gyur lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: What kind of bodhisattva great beings does he not approach?”

original: kun dga' bo /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bshad pa na sems mos par ma gyur pa de dag gi drung du ni /
analyzed: kun dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bshad pa na sems mos par ma gyur pa de dag gi drung du ni /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Ānanda,

original: bdud sdig can mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //🔽kun dga' bo /🔽gzhan @365b yang byang chub sems dpa' gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: bdud sdig can mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas 'ong bar 'gyur ro // kun dga' bo / gzhan @365b yang byang chub sems dpa' gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bshad pa na /
translated: those bodhisattva great beings who, in the past, did not have confidence in this profound perfection of wisdom when it was being taught will be approached by Māra, the evil one, with the intention to harm.🔽“Moreover, Ānanda, when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught,

original: 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin nam /
translated: those bodhisattvas who think, ‘Is this the perfection of wisdom?

original: 'on te 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin snyam du the tshom za bar gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin snyam du the tshom za bar gyur na /
translated: If he has doubts about whether this is the perfection of wisdom,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge dag gi drung du'ang bdud sdig can mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge dag gi drung du'ang bdud sdig can mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Māra, the evil one, will come to the bodhisattva great being with the intention of harming him.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral bar gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral bar gyur na /
translated: further, if a bodhisattva great being is separated from a spiritual friend,

original: des dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag mi mthong bas /
analyzed: des dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag mi mthong bas /
translated: he will not see spiritual friends,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi thos so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi thos so //
translated: and he will not hear this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: ma thos na /
analyzed: ma thos na /
translated: If he does not hear it,

original: mi shes pas /
analyzed: mi shes pas /
translated: he will not know it,

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bsgom par bya zhes de bzhin nyid du sgrub par mi byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bsgom par bya zhes de bzhin nyid du sgrub par mi byed do //
translated: and he will not practice it as it really is, thinking, ‘How should I cultivate this perfection of wisdom?’

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na /
translated: further, if a bodhisattva great being is separated from the perfection of wisdom,

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
translated: He will hold to what is not the true Dharma.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la'ang bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la'ang bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Māra, the evil one, will find an opportunity to harm that bodhisattva great being.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dam pa ma yin pa'i chos kyi bsngags pa brjod na /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dam pa ma yin pa'i chos kyi bsngags pa brjod na /
translated: further, when a bodhisattva who is separated from the perfection of wisdom praises what is not the true Dharma,

original: de la bdud sdig can 'di snyam du /
analyzed: de la bdud sdig can 'di snyam du /
translated: Māra, the evil one, thinks,

original: gang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos kyi bsngags pa brjod pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos kyi bsngags pa brjod pa 'di ni /
translated: ‘The one who praises what is not the true Dharma

original: bdag gi grogs yin te /🔽gang dam pa @366a *//
analyzed: bdag gi grogs yin te / gang dam pa @366a *//
translated: is my friend.

original: ma yin pa'i chos kyi bsngags pa brjod pa de ni /
analyzed: ma yin pa'i chos kyi bsngags pa brjod pa de ni /
translated: The one who praises what is not the true Dharma

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa mang po dag gi nang nas bdag gi grogs su rnyed pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa mang po dag gi nang nas bdag gi grogs su rnyed pa yin te /
translated: is a friend of mine who has been found among the many in the Bodhisattva Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zag gang yin pa de dag kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zag gang yin pa de dag kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: Those persons in the Bodhisattva Vehicle

original: sa gnyis po nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: sa gnyis po nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: will be on the two levels, the śrāvaka level🔽or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis dag la gnas par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis dag la gnas par 'gyur bas na /
translated: and the pratyekabuddhas will abide in purity.

original: 'di ni / bdag gi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / bdag gi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the fulfillment of my wishes.”

original: snyam du sems so //
analyzed: snyam du sems so //
translated: He thinks like this.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji lta bu dag la bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji lta bu dag la bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what kind of bodhisattva great beings will Māra the evil one find an opportunity to harm?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bshad pa na 'di skad du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bshad pa na 'di skad du /
translated: When a bodhisattva is taught this deep perfection of wisdom, he says,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: ‘This perfection of wisdom is deep.

original: zab pas na /
analyzed: zab pas na /
translated: It is not easy to understand.

original: khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mnyan pa dang / bshad pa dang / gzung ba dang / bklag pa dang / kun chub par bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par byas te ci rung /
analyzed: khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mnyan pa dang / bshad pa dang / gzung ba dang / bklag pa dang / kun chub par bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par byas te ci rung /
translated: What is the point of your listening to, explaining, taking up, reading aloud, mastering, or perfecting this deep perfection of wisdom?

original: ngas kyang da dung 'di'i gting ma rnyed na; khyod kyis lta rnyed par mi 'gyur zhes zer na /
analyzed: ngas kyang da dung 'di'i gting ma rnyed na; khyod kyis lta rnyed par mi 'gyur zhes zer na /
translated: I have not even found its depths yet, so how could you find them?’

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la'ang bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la'ang bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Māra, the evil one, will find an opportunity to harm that bodhisattva great being.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,🔽when a bodhisattva thinks highly of other bodhisattvas,

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la rlom sems su byed de /🔽kho bo ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la rlom sems su byed de / kho bo ni /
translated: thinking,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin gyi /
translated: ‘I practice the perfection of generosity,

original: khyod ni / sbyin pa'i @366b pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod ni / sbyin pa'i @366b pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
translated: but you do not practice the perfection of generosity.’

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽kho bo ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / kho bo ni /
translated: Similarly,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la spyod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la spyod pa yin gyi /
translated: ‘I practice up to the perfection of wisdom,

original: khyod ni / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //🔽zhes rlom sems su byed na /🔽kun dga' bo /
analyzed: khyod ni / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no // zhes rlom sems su byed na / kun dga' bo /
translated: but you do not practice the perfection of wisdom.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Māra, the evil one, will find an opportunity to harm that bodhisattva, Ānanda.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag la bstod par sems na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag la bstod par sems na /
translated: Moreover, Ānanda, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas think of praising themselves,

original: de'i tshe bdud sdig can dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / yid rangs pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdud sdig can dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / yid rangs pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: at that time Māra the evil one will be delighted, pleased, and overjoyed, and will experience a sense of satisfaction, joy, and well-being.

original: kun dga' po; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la'ang bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun dga' po; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la'ang bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Ānanda, Māra the evil one will also find an opportunity to harm those bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,🔽when the names and clans

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa'i ming smos sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa'i ming smos sam /
translated: of bodhisattvas are mentioned

original: rus smos te /🔽yongs su bsgrags nas ming smos pa'am /🔽rus smos pa des /
analyzed: rus smos te / yongs su bsgrags nas ming smos pa'am / rus smos pa des /
translated: and proclaimed,

original: de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des pa /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des pa /
translated: those bodhisattvas

original: dge ba'i chos can dag la rlom sems su byed cing /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos can dag la rlom sems su byed cing /
translated: will be conceited about their virtuous qualities

original: bdag bstod par byed /
analyzed: bdag bstod par byed /
translated: and will praise themselves

original: gzhan smod par byed la /
analyzed: gzhan smod par byed la /
translated: and disparage others.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma gang yin pa'i yon tan de dag kyang de la med la /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma gang yin pa'i yon tan de dag kyang de la med la /
translated: “They do not have the qualities of the aspects, signs, and indications of irreversible bodhisattva great beings.

original: de rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag med bzhin du nyon mongs pa bskyed cing bdag la bstod par byed /
analyzed: de rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag med bzhin du nyon mongs pa bskyed cing bdag la bstod par byed /
translated: While lacking those aspects, signs, and indications, they give rise to afflictions and praise themselves.

original: gzhan la smod par byed de /🔽ji ltar kho bo byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa dang / @367a *//
analyzed: gzhan la smod par byed de / ji ltar kho bo byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa dang / @367a *//
translated: They disparage others,🔽saying, ‘Just as I appear in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la yang dag par snang ba ltar /
