analyzed: bdud kyi gnas rnam par 'jig par bgyid pa lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: are destroying the abode of Māra.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed pa de dag la ni /
analyzed: gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed pa de dag la ni /
translated: those who will develop the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: rjes su yi rang bar bgyi ba lags so //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar bgyi ba lags so //
translated: should rejoice in the development of those thoughts.

original: gang dag gis sangs rgyas yongs su ma btang ba dang / chos yongs su ma btang ba dang / dge 'dun yongs su ma btang ba @379b de dag gis kyang sems bskyed pa 'di dag la rjes su yi rang bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis sangs rgyas yongs su ma btang ba dang / chos yongs su ma btang ba dang / dge 'dun yongs su ma btang ba @379b de dag gis kyang sems bskyed pa 'di dag la rjes su yi rang bar bgyi'o //
translated: Those who have not given up the Buddha, have not given up the Dharma, and have not given up the Saṅgha should also rejoice in these thoughts.

original: de dag gis rjes su yi rang nas kyang ci nas kyang gnyis su 'du shes su 'gyur ba ma mchis pa dang / gnyis ma lags pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur ba ma mchis pa de ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gis rjes su yi rang nas kyang ci nas kyang gnyis su 'du shes su 'gyur ba ma mchis pa dang / gnyis ma lags pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur ba ma mchis pa de ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bgyi'o //
translated: Having rejoiced, they should dedicate to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, so that they do not have the notion of duality and do not have the notion of non-duality.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: koo shi ka /🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: koo shi ka / de de bzhin te /
translated: “Kauśika,🔽it is so,

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: it is just as it is,

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: just as you have said.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gang sems bskyed pa de la rjes su yi rang ba de dag ni /
analyzed: gang sems bskyed pa de la rjes su yi rang ba de dag ni /
translated: those who rejoice in those arousals of Awakening Mind

original: myur ba nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: myur ba nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: will quickly please the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas,

original: mnyes par byas nas kyang thugs phyung bar byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyes par byas nas kyang thugs phyung bar byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and having pleased them, will not disappoint them.”

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa la rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa la rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who have the roots of virtue that come from rejoicing in the development of the mind of awakening

original: gang dang gang du skyes pa de dag dang der yang bsti stang du bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dang gang du skyes pa de dag dang der yang bsti stang du bya bar 'gyur /
translated: will be honored wherever they are born.

original: bla mar bya ba dang / ri mor bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla mar bya ba dang / ri mor bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be revered, respected, and worshipped.

original: nam du'ang gzugs yid du mi 'ong ba mthong bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nam du'ang gzugs yid du mi 'ong ba mthong bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will never see an unpleasant form.

original: sgra yid du mi 'ong ba thos par mi 'gyur /🔽dri yid du mi 'ong ba tshor bar mi 'gyur /🔽ro yid du mi 'ong ba myong bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sgra yid du mi 'ong ba thos par mi 'gyur / dri yid du mi 'ong ba tshor bar mi 'gyur / ro yid du mi 'ong ba myong bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will never hear an unpleasant sound.🔽They will never smell an unpleasant smell.🔽They will never taste an unpleasant taste.

original: reg bya yid du mi 'ong ba reg par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: reg bya yid du mi 'ong ba reg par mi 'gyur /
translated: They will never touch an unpleasant touch.

original: chos yid du mi 'ong ba rnam par shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos yid du mi 'ong ba rnam par shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will never cognize an unpleasant mental object.

original: nam du'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nam du'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will never be separated from the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: They will go from buddha realm to buddha realm.

original: sangs @380a *// rgyas bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: sangs @380a *// rgyas bcom ldan 'das /
translated: the blessed buddhas,

original: de dag la'ang bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la'ang bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will plant the roots of virtue.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: 'di ltar / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: it is because those sons of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po grangs med pa dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la rjes su yi rang ba byas shing /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po grangs med pa dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la rjes su yi rang ba byas shing /
translated: and those daughters of a good family have rejoiced in the wholesome roots of countless bodhisattva great beings who have newly entered the vehicle,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa dang / sa dang po la gnas pa rnams dang / sa gnyis pa la gnas pa rnams dang / sa bcu pa'i bar la gnas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang bar byas pa dang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa dang / sa dang po la gnas pa rnams dang / sa gnyis pa la gnas pa rnams dang / sa bcu pa'i bar la gnas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang bar byas pa dang /
translated: and have dedicated them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and have rejoiced in the wholesome roots of those on the first level, those on the second level, up to those on the tenth level,🔽and have dedicated them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag la rjes su yi rang ba byas shing /
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag la rjes su yi rang ba byas shing /
translated: and the wholesome roots of the bodhisattva great beings who are obstructed by one birth,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: having rejoiced in them, and having dedicated them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba rngam par 'phel ba de dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba rngam par 'phel ba de dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By those wholesome roots increasing greatly, they will approach unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sems can tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sems can tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed par 'gyur te /
translated: And having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they will cause countless, immeasurable, incalculable sentient beings to pass into complete nirvāṇa.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na /
translated: through this one of many explanations,

original: rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la @380b rjes su yi rang zhing /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la @380b rjes su yi rang zhing /
translated: Those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage should rejoice in the roots of virtue of those bodhisattva great beings who have generated the first level of bodhicitta

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /🔽ci nas kyang sems de la'ang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste / ci nas kyang sems de la'ang ma yin zhing /
translated: and they should dedicate this toward unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.🔽They should dedicate this in such a manner that it is not the mind,

original: sems gzhan la'ang ma yin pa de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems gzhan la'ang ma yin pa de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: nor is it any other mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyad pa spyod pa rnams dang / phyir mi ldog pa rnams dang / skya ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la'ang rjes su yi rang zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyad pa spyod pa rnams dang / phyir mi ldog pa rnams dang / skya ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la'ang rjes su yi rang zhing /
translated: They should rejoice in the roots of virtue of those bodhisattva great beings who practice the bodhisattva conduct, those who are irreversible, and those who are impeded by a single birth,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
translated: and they should dedicate this toward unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.🔽They should dedicate this in such a manner that it is not the mind,

original: ci nas kyang sems de la'ang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ci nas kyang sems de la'ang ma yin zhing /
translated: nor is it any other mind.

original: sems gzhan la'ang ma yin pa de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems gzhan la'ang ma yin pa de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should dedicate in such a way that the mind is not directed elsewhere.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: ji ltar na /

analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin la / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar yang mi rtog /
translated: the perfection of morality,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin /
translated: and the perfection of generosity also not conceptualize and do not discriminate?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar yang mi rtog /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,🔽the perfection of generosity and so on, up to

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
translated: the perfection of meditative stability do not conceptualize and do not discriminate.”

original: sh'a ri'i dus  smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i dus  smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor / 'o na ci /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,🔽then is it only the perfection of wisdom that does not conceptualize and does not discriminate,🔽or do form,

original: gzugs kyang mi rtog /🔽rnam par mi rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs kyang mi rtog /🔽rnam par mi rtog pa yin la /
translated: and so on up to

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang mi rtog /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang mi rtog /
translated: He does not conceptualize feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Are feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness also non-conceptual and non-analytical?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /🔽ci / mig kyang mi rtog /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor / ci / mig kyang mi rtog /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin la /🔽rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang mi rtog /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin la / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang mi rtog /
translated: are the eyes also non-conceptual and non-analytical?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Are the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind also non-conceptual and non-analytical?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /🔽ci / gzugs kyang mi rtog /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor / ci / gzugs kyang mi rtog /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin la /🔽sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyang mi rtog /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin la / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyang mi rtog /
translated: are forms also non-conceptual and non-analytical?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Are sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena also non-conceptual and non-analytical?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar dang / @385b mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba dang /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar dang / @385b mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba dang /
translated: Are eye consciousness and up to mental consciousness, and eye contact and up to mind contact, and the feelings that arise from the condition of eye contact and up to the feelings that arise from the condition of mind contact also non-conceptual and non-analytical?

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung pa'i tshor ba'ang mi rtog /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung pa'i tshor ba'ang mi rtog /
translated: Feelings that arise from the condition of the meeting of mind, phenomena, and the faculty of mind are also nonconceptual.🔽

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Is feeling that arises from the condition of the meeting of mind and mental phenomena also non-conceptual and non-discriminating?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /🔽ci / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyang mi rtog /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor / ci / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyang mi rtog /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / de bzhin du sbyar te 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin kyang mi rtog /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / de bzhin du sbyar te 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin kyang mi rtog /
translated: are the meditative concentrations, the immeasurable aspirations, and the formless absorptions also non-conceptual and non-discriminating?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'ang mi rtog /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'ang mi rtog /
translated: Are the applications of mindfulness, and in the same vein, , up to and including the noble eightfold path, and the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness meditative stabilizations also non-conceptual and non-discriminating?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: Are the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and great loving kindness and great compassion also non-conceptual and non-discriminating?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dang / sangs rgyas kyang mi rtog /🔽rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /🔽byang chub kyang mi rtog /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dang / sangs rgyas kyang mi rtog / rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam / byang chub kyang mi rtog /
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and also a buddha is not conceptual and not nonconceptual,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /🔽'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyang mi rtog /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam / 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyang mi rtog /
translated: and also enlightenment is not conceptual and not nonconceptual,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin nam /
translated: and also the compounded element and the uncompounded element are not conceptual and not nonconceptual?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽chos thams cad kyang mi rtog /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / chos thams cad kyang mi rtog /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
translated: all phenomena are not conceptual and not nonconceptual.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /🔽gal te chos thams cad mi rtog /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor / gal te chos thams cad mi rtog /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin na /
translated: if all phenomena are not conceptual and not nonconceptual,

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang / mi'i 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba zhes tha dad du dbye ba 'di ci las gyur /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang / mi'i 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba zhes tha dad du dbye ba 'di ci las gyur /
translated: why are there these different designations: ‘hell beings,’ ‘animals,’ ‘ghosts,’ ‘gods,’ and ‘humans’ in the five transmigrations?”

original: rgyun du @386a *//
analyzed: rgyun du @386a *//
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: zhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ces bya ba'i bar du rab tu dbye ba'ang ci las gyur /🔽de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: zhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ces bya ba'i bar du rab tu dbye ba'ang ci las gyur / de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: What is the classification of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, from the time when they first produce the thought of enlightenment until they are seated at the Focal Point of Enlightenment?🔽The venerable Subhūti having said this, the venerable Śāriputra addressed him as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: these beings

original: phyin ci log las byung ba'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: phyin ci log las byung ba'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: are engaged in the actions of body, speech, and mind that arise from error.

original: gzhi de las 'dun pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin cing mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gzhi de las 'dun pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin cing mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: On the basis of that, they appropriate and accomplish the maturation of karma that arises from the root of desire.

original: yongs su bzung bas rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang / mi'i 'gro ba dag mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su bzung bas rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang / mi'i 'gro ba dag mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: Through appropriation, they accomplish the destinies of hell beings, animals, ghosts, gods, and humans, which arise from discursive thought.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gang yang khyod 'di skad du rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas zhes rab tu dbye ba'ang ci las gyur /
analyzed: gang yang khyod 'di skad du rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas zhes rab tu dbye ba'ang ci las gyur /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, why is there this differentiation into stream enterer, once-returner, non-returner, worthy one, pratyekabuddha,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i bar du dbye ba'ang ci las gyur ces zer ba na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i bar du dbye ba'ang ci las gyur ces zer ba na /
translated: and even up to ‘buddha, blessed one’?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: the stream enterer and the result of stream enterer

original: rnam par mi rtog pas rab tu phye ba yin la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pas rab tu phye ba yin la /
translated: are differentiated by nonconceptuality.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid dang / rang byang chub kyang rnam par mi rtog pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid dang / rang byang chub kyang rnam par mi rtog pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: Up to the worthy one, the pratyekabuddha, and pratyekabuddha awakening are differentiated by nonconceptuality.

original: sangs rgyas kyang rnam par mi rtog pas rab tu phye ba yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang rnam par mi rtog pas rab tu phye ba yin la /
translated: The buddha is differentiated by nonconceptuality.

original: byang chub kyang rnam par mi rtog pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyang rnam par mi rtog pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: Awakening is differentiated by nonconceptuality.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin @386b gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang dag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba /
analyzed: de bzhin @386b gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang dag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba /
translated: the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas who have appeared in the past, those lord buddhas, were also without conceptualization,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba /
translated: free from conceptualization,

original: rnam par rtog pa spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa spangs pa yin la /
translated: and had abandoned conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du ma byon pa rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa spong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma byon pa rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa spong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: In the same way, those who will appear in the future will also abandon conceptualization.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par🔽rtog pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga'/
translated: the lord buddhas who are present now, the lord buddhas who have attained supreme perfect enlightenment in the world systems of the ten directions, those lord buddhas are also without conceptualization,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba /
translated: free from conceptualization,🔽and have abandoned conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa spangs pa yin te /
translated: He is free from conceptualization.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na /
translated: by this one of many explanations,

original: 'di ltar / rnam par mi rtog pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid tshad mar byas nas chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rnam par mi rtog pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid tshad mar byas nas chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: in this way, all phenomena should be known to be free from conceptualization, having taken as a measure the suchness of nonconceptuality, the suchness of the very limit of reality, and the suchness of the dharma-constituent.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste /
translated: bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom that is nonconceptual in that way.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na /
translated: Having practiced the perfection of wisdom that is nonconceptual,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will fully awaken to the nonconceptual dharmas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines,🔽it says:

original: rnam par mi rtog pa bstan pa'i dpe brjod pa'i le'u zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa bstan pa'i dpe brjod pa'i le'u zhes bya ste /
translated: Chapter 1. The Presentation of Nonconceptuality🔽

original: lnga bcu rtsa brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: lnga bcu rtsa brgyad pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the fifty-eighth chapter, on the teaching of non-conceptuality, in the “Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis pa /🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i @387a *//
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis pa / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i @387a *//
translated: Chapter Fifty-Nine: The Four Immeasurables

original: bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa de ni /
analyzed: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa de ni /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings who practice this perfection of wisdom

original: snying po la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: snying po la spyod pa yin no //
translated: practice with the core.

original: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
analyzed: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings

original: snying po la spyod pa yin no //🔽de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: snying po la spyod pa yin no // de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: practice with the core.”🔽When this had been said, the venerable Subhūti said to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni /
analyzed: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni /
translated: “Alas, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: snying po med pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: snying po med pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: are practicing with what is essenceless.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni /
translated: it is because the perfection of wisdom up to the knowledge of all aspects

original: snying po med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying po med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is essenceless.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽'di ltar / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas snying po med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / 'di ltar / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas snying po med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
translated: it is because bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not apprehend and do not see even essencelessness,

original: snying po dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: snying po dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: let alone apprehend an essence.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang snying po med pa yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang snying po med pa yin na /
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to the knowledge of all aspects being essenceless,

original: snying po dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying po dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: lha'i bu dag /

analyzed: lha'i bu dag /

analyzed: nam mkha' gdul bar bya'o // snyam du sems pa yin no //

analyzed: sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad bdud sdig can sha stag tu gyur la /
translated: Subhūti, if all the sentient beings in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River were to become Māra the evil ones,

original: bdud sdig can re res kyang bdud sdig can de snyed cig mngon par sprul kyang de dag thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: bdud sdig can re res kyang bdud sdig can de snyed cig mngon par sprul kyang de dag thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
translated: Even if each of the evil Māras were to conjure up that many evil Māras, they would all be unable to disturb a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings endowed with two dharmas

original: bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thul ba yin te /
analyzed: bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thul ba yin te /
translated: cannot be defeated by the evil Māras.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: des chos thams cad la stong pa nyid du rnam par bltas pa dang / des sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba yin te /
analyzed: des chos thams cad la stong pa nyid du rnam par bltas pa dang / des sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba yin te /
translated: They are: (1) having seen all dharmas as emptiness, and (2) not having abandoned any sentient being.

original: rab 'byor / chos gnyis po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos gnyis po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings endowed with those two dharmas

original: bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thul ba yin no //
analyzed: bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thul ba yin no //
translated: cannot be defeated by the evil Māras.”🔽“Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽should train in the perfection of wisdom like that.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /🔽bdud sdig can @390a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni / bdud sdig can @390a *//
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who is endowed with two dharmas, courses in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Mara, the Evil One, will not get the chance to disturb him.

original: rnams kyis mi thul ba yin te /
analyzed: rnams kyis mi thul ba yin te /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the evil Māras cannot defeat bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom and have two dharmas.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa yin te /🔽rab 'byor / chos gnyis po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa yin te / rab 'byor / chos gnyis po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: They do as they say and are contemplated by the lord buddhas.

original: bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud sdig can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, the evil Māras cannot defeat bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom and have those two dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du lha'i bu rnams kyang bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / yongs su zhu ba dang / yongs su dri ba'i phyir nye bar 'gro bar sems shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du lha'i bu rnams kyang bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / yongs su zhu ba dang / yongs su dri ba'i phyir nye bar 'gro bar sems shing /
translated: Subhūti, the divine princes think, ‘We should go into the presence of bodhisattva great beings who practice like that to serve them, to attend on them, and to ask questions.’

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

original: de lta bas na /

original: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: khyod 'di lta ste /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family,

analyzed: khyod gnas pa de dag gis gnas na /

translated: you will be a protector for sentient beings without a protector, you will be a refuge for sentient beings without a refuge, you will be an ally for sentient beings without an ally, you will be a support for sentient beings without a support,

translated: They will become a support for sentient beings who have no support, an island for those who have no island, and a light for those who are in the dark.🔽’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Because, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings who have those articles of the good qualities of the perfection of wisdom teach the doctrine by way of proclaiming the names and clans of those bodhisattva great beings and also make an exalted utterance.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dper na / da ltar nga byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin po che tog gi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtsug tor can gyi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa dang /
translated: for example, I now teach the doctrine and make an exalted utterance by way of proclaiming the name of the bodhisattva great being Ratnaketu and also make an exalted utterance by way of proclaiming the name of the bodhisattva great being Śikhī.

original: nga byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i drung du tshangs par spyad pa spyod cing /

translated: “Bhagavān, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practiced celibacy for a long time in the presence of the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Akṣobhya,🔽

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang ma bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi ming @391a *//
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang ma bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi ming @391a *//
translated: “Subhūti, I teach the Dharma to those bodhisattva great beings who are living the holy life in the presence of the lord, the tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete Buddha Akṣobhya, and I make proclamations about those bodhisattva great beings who are not separated from this perfection of wisdom.🔽I teach the Dharma to them in the manner of proclaiming their names

original: yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa bzhin no //

translated: and I make proclamations.”🔽“Subhūti, those lord buddhas who are dwelling and maintaining themselves, teaching the Dharma in the east, those lord buddhas too, Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / shar phyogs na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag 'di ltar tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa de dag la
analyzed: rab 'byor / shar phyogs na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag 'di ltar tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa de dag la
translated: are proclaiming the names of those bodhisattva great beings who are living the holy life in that way,

original: dga' bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //🔽de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / steng dang / 'og dang / phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag tshangs par spyad pa spyod
analyzed: dga' bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do // de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / steng dang / 'og dang / phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag tshangs par spyad pa spyod
translated: and they also express their approval by teaching the Dharma in a way that delights them.

original: cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang ma bral ba de dag la dga' bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du rjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang ma bral ba de dag la dga' bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du rjod par mdzad do //
translated: In the same way, the lord buddhas who are present, living, and remaining in the world systems in the south, west, and north, in the intermediate directions, below and above, who are teaching the Dharma, those lord buddhas also teach the Dharma in a way that delights those bodhisattva great beings who are living the holy life in their midst, who are not separated from this perfection of wisdom, and they also express their approval.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste byang chub kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa'i bar de dag la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dga' bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du rjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste byang chub kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa'i bar de dag la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dga' bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du rjod par mdzad do //
translated: “Subhūti, the Lord Buddhas also teach the Dharma to the bodhisattva great beings who, from the time when they first began to set their mind on enlightenment, have been perfecting the path to enlightenment and will attain the knowledge of all aspects, and they also make a proclamation of it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: “Bhagavān, what are the names of those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are irreversible from the highest, complete enlightenment, and who are delighted by the Tathāgata’s teaching the Dharma in this way?”
