original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing chos thams cad skye ba med par mos kyang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ma thob pa dag dang / chos thams cad stong pa zhes bya bar mos kyang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ma thob pa dag dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing chos thams cad skye ba med par mos kyang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ma thob pa dag dang / chos thams cad stong pa zhes bya bar mos kyang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ma thob pa dag dang /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, there are those bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom and who believe that all phenomena are non-arisen, but who have not attained the acceptance that phenomena are non-arisen.🔽There are those who believe that all phenomena are empty, but who have not attained the acceptance that phenomena are non-arisen.

original: chos thams cad zhi ba zhes bya bar mos pa dang / chos thams cad 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba dang / gsog ces bya ba dang / ya ma brla zhes bya ba dang / snying po med pa zhes bya bar mos kyang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ma thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la /
analyzed: chos thams cad zhi ba zhes bya bar mos pa dang / chos thams cad 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba dang / gsog ces bya ba dang / ya ma brla zhes bya ba dang / snying po med pa zhes bya bar mos kyang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ma thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la /
translated: There are those who believe that all phenomena are peaceful, that all phenomena are free from attachment, that all phenomena are hollow, that all phenomena are worthless, and that all phenomena are insubstantial, but who have not attained the acceptance that phenomena are non-arisen.

original: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dga' bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du rjod par mdzad do //🔽rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @392b chen po gang dag gi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / dga' bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du rjod par mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dga' bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du rjod par mdzad do // rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @392b chen po gang dag gi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / dga' bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du rjod par mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
translated: Subhuti, the Lord Buddhas teach the Dharma and utter words of appreciation in a way that delights them.🔽Subhuti, the Lord Buddhas teach the Dharma and utter words of appreciation in a way that delights those Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas whose names they utter.

original: rab 'byor / nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su spangs shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su spangs shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Subhuti, those Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas will be predicted to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, having abandoned the level of the śrāvakas and the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag gi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du rjod par mdzad pa'i byang
analyzed: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag gi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du rjod par mdzad pa'i byang
translated: “Subhūti, the lord buddhas teach the Dharma to the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom by way of proclaiming the names of those bodhisattva great beings, and they also make proclamations about them.

original: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
analyzed: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings

original: phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: will stand in irreversibility,

original: de la gnas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and standing in that will reach the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo thos nas 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo thos nas 'di ni /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings hear the profound perfection of wisdom, they think,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ji skad gsungs pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ji skad gsungs pa de bzhin no //
translated: ‘It is just as the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas have said.’

original: zhes nem nur med cing the tshom mi za la rmongs par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: zhes nem nur med cing the tshom mi za la rmongs par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If they are not doubtful, uncertain, and confused about that,

original: des ni / phyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu de dag las 'di nyid rgya cher thos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni / phyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu de dag las 'di nyid rgya cher thos par 'gyur te /
translated: then later on they will hear this very extensive Dharma discourse from the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly awakened Buddha Akṣobhya and from those sons of enlightened heritage who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mos par 'gyur zhing /🔽shes rab @393a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mos par 'gyur zhing / shes rab @393a *//
translated: Those sons of enlightened heritage who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas will have conviction in this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos pa na /
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos pa na /
translated: When they have conviction in this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pas ji skad gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pas ji skad gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: they will think, “This is just as the Tathāgata has said.”

original: zhes mos shing phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes mos shing phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: They will have conviction in this and will abide in the state of irreversibility.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos pa'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la de ltar gces spras byed pa yin na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos pa'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la de ltar gces spras byed pa yin na /
translated: Subhūti, if the perfection of wisdom, even when heard, is so very helpful to bodhisattva great beings,

original: gang mos shing mos nas kyang de bzhin nyid du gnas shing de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed pa dang / de bzhin nyid du gnas shing de bzhin nyid du bsgrubs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang mos shing mos nas kyang de bzhin nyid du gnas shing de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed pa dang / de bzhin nyid du gnas shing de bzhin nyid du bsgrubs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to speak of those who, having faith in it, abide in suchness and practice in suchness, and, having abided in suchness and practiced in suchness, will stand in the knowledge of all aspects?

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gang de bzhin nyid du gnas shing /
analyzed: gang de bzhin nyid du gnas shing /
translated: if, having abided in suchness

original: de bzhin nyid du bsgrubs na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du bsgrubs na /
translated: and practiced in suchness,

original: chos gang yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ba lags na /
analyzed: chos gang yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ba lags na /
translated: no dharma at all is apprehended,

original: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas pa 'gyur lags /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas pa 'gyur lags /
translated: how will they stand in the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhes bgyi ba'i chos gang yang dmigs su ma mchis na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhes bgyi ba'i chos gang yang dmigs su ma mchis na /
translated: if no dharma at all called a tathāgata emanation is apprehended,

original: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur /
translated: Who will abide in suchness?

original: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
translated: Who, having abided in suchness, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur te /
translated: Who, having abided in suchness, will teach the Dharma?

original: de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
translated: Since suchness is not apprehended,

original: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba @393b dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci 'tshal te /
analyzed: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba @393b dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci 'tshal te /
translated: how could anyone abide in suchness, and having abided in suchness, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and having abided in suchness, teach the Dharma?

original: de ni / gnas ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de ni / gnas ma mchis lags so //
translated: That is not possible.”🔽Venerable Subhūti having said that, the Lord said to him,

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: rab 'byor / khyod 'di skad du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod 'di skad du /
translated: Subhūti, you have said,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhes bgyi ba'i chos gang yang ma mchis na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhes bgyi ba'i chos gang yang ma mchis na /
translated: “There is no dharma whatsoever called ‘an emanation of the Tathāgata.’

original: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur /
translated: Who will abide in suchness?

original: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
translated: Who, abiding in suchness, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur te /
translated: Who, abiding in suchness, will teach the Dharma?

original: de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
translated: Since suchness is not apprehended,

original: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci 'tshal te /
analyzed: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci 'tshal te /
translated: who will abide in suchness, and who, abiding in suchness, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and who, abiding in suchness, will teach the Dharma?

original: de ni / gnas ma mchis lags so //🔽zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de ni / gnas ma mchis lags so //🔽zhes zer ba ni /
translated: That is impossible.”

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin to /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin to / de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is so!

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid ma gtogs par chos gang yang dmigs su med na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid ma gtogs par chos gang yang dmigs su med na /
translated: Subhūti, apart from suchness, no dharma can be apprehended.🔽If, Subhūti, apart from suchness, no dharma can be apprehended, then who would abide in suchness, and who, abiding in suchness, would fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: gang zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / gang zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / gang zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / gang zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / gang zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur te /
translated: And who, abiding in suchness, would teach the Dharma?

original: de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med na /🔽gang de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du sbyar @394a *//
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med na / gang de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du sbyar @394a *//
translated: Since suchness itself cannot be apprehended,

original: te / de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur ba'i bar dag lta ci smos te /
analyzed: te / de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur ba'i bar dag lta ci smos te /
translated: how could there be someone who would abide in suchness, and similarly, connect this with each, up to who, abiding in suchness, would teach the Dharma?

original: de ni / gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni / gnas med do //
translated: That is not possible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: Subhūti, whether the tathāgatas arise or do not arise,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether or not the Tathāgatas arise,🔽this suchness, unmistaken suchness, unaltered suchness,

original: de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' 'di ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' 'di ni /
translated: the very essence of phenomena, the expanse of reality, the establishment of phenomena, the establishment of the very essence of phenomena,

original: gnas pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: gnas pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: and the very limit of reality remain just as they are.

original: rab 'byor / gang de bzhin nyid la gnas pa su'ang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang de bzhin nyid la gnas pa su'ang med /
translated: Subhūti, there is no one who abides in suchness,

original: de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'ang med /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'ang med /
translated: there is no one who, having abided in suchness, fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur pa'ang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur pa'ang med do //
translated: and there is no one who, having abided in suchness, teaches the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,🔽it is because

original: 'di ltar / de bzhin nyid la ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar / de bzhin nyid la ni /
translated: in suchness

original: gang de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / gang de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / gang de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / gang de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / gang de bzhin nyid la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the one who would abide in suchness, the one who, having abided in suchness, would fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and the one who, having abided in suchness, would teach the Dharma—all are not apprehended.

original: de ltar de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med pas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med pas /
translated: Thus suchness itself is not apprehended.

original: de la skye ba'ang dmigs su med /
analyzed: de la skye ba'ang dmigs su med /
translated: There is no arising apprehended in it.

original: 'jig pa'ang med /
analyzed: 'jig pa'ang med /
translated: There is no destruction.

original: gnas pa'ang med /
analyzed: gnas pa'ang med /
translated: There is no abiding.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba'ang med de /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba'ang med de /
translated: There is no transformation.

original: de'i phyir chos de la skye ba dmigs su med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas pa med pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba med pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos de la skye ba dmigs su med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas pa med pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba med pas na /
translated: Therefore, because in that phenomenon there is no arising apprehended, no destruction, no abiding, and no transformation,

original: su zhig de la gnas par @394b 'gyur /
analyzed: su zhig de la gnas par @394b 'gyur /
translated: who would abide in it?

original: su zhig de la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: su zhig de la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
translated: Who, having abided in it, would fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: su zhig de la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: su zhig de la gnas nas chos ston par 'gyur te /
translated: Who, abiding in that, would teach the Dharma?

original: de ni / gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni / gnas med do //
translated: There is no such basis.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: this perfection of wisdom

original: zab pa lags te /
analyzed: zab pa lags te /
translated: is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba dag ni /
translated: those bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: dka' ba bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: dka' ba bgyid pa lags so //
translated: are doing what is difficult.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: gang yang de bzhin nyid la gnas pa su'ang ma mchis shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'ang gang yang ma mchis la /
analyzed: gang yang de bzhin nyid la gnas pa su'ang ma mchis shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'ang gang yang ma mchis la /
translated: there is no one at all abiding in suchness, there is no one at all fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: chos ston pa'ang gang yang ma mchis kyang /
analyzed: chos ston pa'ang gang yang ma mchis kyang /
translated: and there is no one at all teaching the Dharma,

original: de la zhum par yang mi 'gyur /🔽de la nem nur yang mi bgyid /
analyzed: de la zhum par yang mi 'gyur / de la nem nur yang mi bgyid /
translated: they will not be discouraged;🔽they will not be doubtful;

original: rmongs par yang mi 'gyur ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: rmongs par yang mi 'gyur ba'i slad du'o //
translated: they will not be confused.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: gang khyod 'di skad du /
analyzed: gang khyod 'di skad du /
translated: when you say

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag chos zab mo rnams la nem nur med cing rmongs pa med pa ni /🔽dka' ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag chos zab mo rnams la nem nur med cing rmongs pa med pa ni / dka' ba byed pa yin no //
translated: ‘those bodhisattva great beings who are not doubtful and confused about the profound dharmas

original: zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: zhes zer ba ni /
translated: are doing what is difficult,’

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin pas na /
translated: since all dharmas are empty,

original: de la su zhig nem nur ram rmongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la su zhig nem nur ram rmongs par 'gyur /
translated: who would be doubtful or confused about them?”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the elder Subhūti:

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor @395a *//
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor @395a *//
translated: “The elder Subhūti,

original: ni; gang ci ston kyang de thams cad stong pa nyid las brtsams shing ston te /
analyzed: ni; gang ci ston kyang de thams cad stong pa nyid las brtsams shing ston te /
translated: whatever he teaches, teaches it all starting from emptiness.

original: ci la'ang chags pa med do //
analyzed: ci la'ang chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to anything.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / mda' nam mkha' la 'phangs pa ni /
analyzed: dper na / mda' nam mkha' la 'phangs pa ni /
translated: An arrow shot into the sky

original: gang du'ang chags pa med do //
analyzed: gang du'ang chags pa med do //
translated: is not attached to anything.

original: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis chos bstan pa'ang gang du'ang chags pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis chos bstan pa'ang gang du'ang chags pa med do //
translated: In the same way, the teaching of the Dharma by the elder Subhūti is not attached to anything.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines,

original: chags pa med pa'i le'u zhes bya ste; lnga bcu rtsa dgu pa'o ////
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i le'u zhes bya ste; lnga bcu rtsa dgu pa'o ////
translated: this is the fifty-ninth chapter, “Nonattachment.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol te //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol te //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: bdag gis de skad smras shing de skad bstan pa; bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rjes su smra zhing chos smra ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos yang dag par brjod pa lags sam /
analyzed: bdag gis de skad smras shing de skad bstan pa; bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rjes su smra zhing chos smra ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos yang dag par brjod pa lags sam /
translated: have I stated and taught this in accord with what the Lord has said, in accord with the purport of the Lord’s teaching, and in a way that accords with reality, in a way that does not contradict reality?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: gang khyod kyis de skad smras shing de skad bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang khyod kyis de skad smras shing de skad bstan pa ni /
translated: “You have spoken thus, and taught thus,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i rjes su smra zhing chos smra ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i rjes su smra zhing chos smra ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos brjod pa yin no //
translated: and you have spoken in accordance with the Tathāgata’s teaching, and you have taught the Dharma, and you have expressed the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śatakratu then said, “Lord,

original: ji tsam du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis spobs pa de thams cad ni /
analyzed: ji tsam du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis spobs pa de thams cad ni /
translated: to whatever extent the elder Subhūti has spoken,

original: stong pa nyid las brtsams shing spobs pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa las brtsams shing spobs pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi bar las brtsams shing spobs pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las brtsams shing spobs pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa las brtsams shing spobs pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi bar las brtsams shing spobs pa ste /
translated: he has spoken from emptiness, he has spoken from signlessness, he has spoken from wishlessness, he has spoken from the applications of mindfulness, up to he has spoken from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ngo mtshar lags so //🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis @395b lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽koo shi ka /
analyzed: ngo mtshar lags so // de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis @395b lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // koo shi ka /
translated: It is amazing!

original: rab 'byor 'di ni stong pa nyid kyis gnas pas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni stong pa nyid kyis gnas pas na /
translated: ” The Lord having said that, Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to him, “Lord, it is amazing how much the elder Subhūti has spoken from emptiness,🔽from signlessness, from wishlessness, from the applications of mindfulness, up to from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The perfection of generosity itself is non-apprehensible,

original: gang dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: so what need is there to speak of those who practice the perfection of generosity?

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: the perfection of wisdom itself is non-apprehensible,

original: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: so what need is there to speak of those who practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The applications of mindfulness themselves are non-apprehensible,

original: gang dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sgom pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sgom pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: so what need is there to speak of those who cultivate the applications of mindfulness?

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: lam nyid kyi bar yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: lam nyid kyi bar yang mi dmigs na /
translated: the path itself is non-apprehensible,

original: gang dag lam sgom par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag lam sgom par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: so what need is there to speak of those who cultivate the path?

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: the meditative stabilities, the immeasurable aspirations, the gateways of mnemonic incantation, and the gateways of meditative stability themselves are non-apprehensible,

original: gang dag bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa sgom pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa sgom pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to speak of those who cultivate the meditative stabilities, the immeasurable aspirations, the forms of liberation, the meditative concentrations, and the formless absorptions?

original: stobs rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: stobs rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The powers themselves are non-apprehensible,

original: gang dag stobs rnams la sgom pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag stobs rnams la sgom pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: so what need is there to speak of those who cultivate the powers?

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The fearlessnesses themselves are non-apprehensible,

original: gang dag mi 'jigs pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag mi 'jigs pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: so what need is there to speak of those who actualize the fearlessnesses?

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The detailed and thorough knowledges themselves are non-apprehensible,

original: gang dag so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: so what need is there to speak of those who actualize the detailed and thorough knowledges?

original: byams pa chen po nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: byams pa chen po nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: Great love itself is non-apprehensible,

original: gang dag byams pa chen po la gnas par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /🔽snying rje @396a *//
analyzed: gang dag byams pa chen po la gnas par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos / snying rje @396a *//
translated: so what need is there to speak of those who abide in great love?

original: chen po nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: chen po nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: Great compassion itself is non-apprehensible,🔽so what need is there to speak of those who abide in great compassion?

original: gang dag snying rje chen po la gnas par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag snying rje chen po la gnas par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to speak of those who abide in great compassion?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The distinct qualities of the buddhas themselves are non-apprehensible,

original: gang dag sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: so what need is there to speak of those who accomplish the distinct qualities of the buddhas?

original: byang chub nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: byang chub nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: Enlightenment itself is non-apprehensible,

original: gang dag byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: so what need is there to speak of those who will fully awaken to enlightenment?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: Omniscience itself is non-apprehensible,

original: gang dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: so what need is there to speak of those who will attain omniscience?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The Thus-Gone One himself is non-apprehensible,

original: gang dag de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: so what need is there to speak of those who will become thus-gone ones?

original: skye ba med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: skye ba med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: Non-arising itself is non-apprehensible,🔽so what need is there to speak of those who will attain non-arising?

original: gang dag skye ba med pa mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag skye ba med pa mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to speak of those who will actualize the absence of arising?

original: mtshan rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: mtshan rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: Even the marks are not apprehended,

original: gang dag gi lus la mtshan rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang dag gi lus la mtshan rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to speak of those on whose bodies the marks will appear?

original: dpe byad bzang po rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po rnams nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: Even the excellent signs are not apprehended,

original: gang gi lus la dpe byad bzang po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang gi lus la dpe byad bzang po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to speak of those on whose bodies the excellent signs will appear?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: dge slong rab 'byor ni /
analyzed: dge slong rab 'byor ni /
translated: the monk Subhūti

original: chos thams cad dben pa la gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: chos thams cad dben pa la gnas pa yin la /
translated: is one who abides in the voidness of all phenomena.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: dge slong rab 'byor ni /
analyzed: dge slong rab 'byor ni /
translated: the monk Subhūti

original: dmigs pa med pa la gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / smon pa med pa la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa la gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / smon pa med pa la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is one who abides in the absence of apprehending, who abides in emptiness, who abides in signlessness, and who abides in wishlessness.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: dge slong rab 'byor gyi gnas pa ni /
analyzed: dge slong rab 'byor gyi gnas pa ni /
translated: the monk Subhūti’s way of abiding

original: de lta bu yin @396b te; koo shi ka /
analyzed: de lta bu yin @396b te; koo shi ka /
translated: is like that.

original: dge slong rab 'byor gyi gnas pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dge slong rab 'byor gyi gnas pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The abode of the monk Subhūti

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i gnas pa'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //🔽stong gi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i gnas pa'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o // stong gi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: does not approach a hundredth part of the abode of the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom.🔽It does not approach a thousandth part.

original: 'bum gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'bum gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not approach a hundred-thousandth part.

original: bye ba phrag 'bum gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: bye ba phrag 'bum gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not approach a ten-millionth part.

original: grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not approach a count, a fraction, a calculation, an example, or a simile.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa de dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi gnas pa gang yin pa'i gnas pa de dag gi nang na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa de dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi gnas pa gang yin pa'i gnas pa de dag gi nang na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Except for the station of the Tathagata, whatever station of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom, and whatever station of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, among those stations, the station of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mchog ces bya ba dang / thu bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang / rab dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med pa zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba dang / thu bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang / rab dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med pa zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is called supreme, chief, exalted, excellent, sublime, unsurpassed, and peerless.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: therefore,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur bar 'dod pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur bar 'dod pas 'di lta ste /
translated: if a bodhisattva-mahāsattva wishes to be supreme among all beings,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gnas pa 'di nyid kyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gnas pa 'di nyid kyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: “You should stand in this very perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; koo shi ka /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; koo shi ka /
translated: And why?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' zhing /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' zhing /
translated: pass beyond the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la @397a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la @397a *//
translated: and enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva🔽and, having completed all the buddhadharmas, attain the knowledge of all aspects,

original: 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bag chags dang /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bag chags dang /
translated: and, having attained the knowledge of all aspects, they attain the elimination of all the tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha’s propensities,

original: mtshams sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: connections, and afflictions.”🔽“Subhūti, what is the elimination of all the tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha’s propensities, connections, and afflictions?”

original: de nas 'khor de nyid las sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyis me tog mand'a ra ba dag blangs nas bcom ldan 'das la gtor to //🔽mngon par gtor to //
analyzed: de nas 'khor de nyid las sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyis me tog mand'a ra ba dag blangs nas bcom ldan 'das la gtor to // mngon par gtor to //
translated: They scattered them and scattered them again.

original: mngon par rab tu gtor to //
analyzed: mngon par rab tu gtor to //
translated: They scattered them and scattered them again.

analyzed: dge slong drug stong yang stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /

translated: Through the power of the Buddha, their cupped hands became filled with mandāra flowers, and they scattered those mandāra flowers over the Tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha.

original: mngon par gtor /
analyzed: mngon par gtor /
translated: They scattered them and scattered them again.🔽They scattered them and scattered them again.🔽They scattered them and scattered them again.🔽They scattered them and scattered them again.

analyzed: mngon par rab tu gtor ba'i tshe tshig 'di skad du /
translated: When they had scattered them, they said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag cag gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnas ma lags pa'i gnas pa dam pa 'dis gnas par gyur cig /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag cag gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnas ma lags pa'i gnas pa dam pa 'dis gnas par gyur cig /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: ces kyang smras so //
analyzed: ces kyang smras so //
translated: through these roots of virtue, may we dwell in this sublime dwelling that is not the dwelling of all śrāvakas and pratyeka­buddhas.”

analyzed: de nas bcom @397b ldan 'das kyis dge slong de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud nas de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: Then the Bhagavān, knowing the thoughts that were in the minds of those bhikṣus, at that time smiled.

analyzed: 'di ni / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid de /

analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad pa na / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas 'od zer kha dog du ma /

original: kha dog sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
translated: from the mouth of the Bhagavān rays of light of many different colors🔽issue forth,

analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / btsod ka dang / shel dang / dngul gyi kha dog lta bu dag byung bar gyur te /

analyzed: de dag gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bas khyab par byas nas slar log ste bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gtsug tu nub par gyur to //
translated: They illuminated the great trichiliocosm and then returned and circled the Blessed One three times before disappearing into the crown of his head.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das ga la bde logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad🔽ces gsol to //

translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee. He bowed to the Blessed One with his palms together and asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni / rgyu ma mchis /

analyzed: rkyen ma mchis par 'dzum pa mi mdzad lags na / bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu ni /

analyzed: gang lags / rkyen ni /

analyzed: gang lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

analyzed: dge slong drug stong po 'di dag ni / bskal pa skar ma lta bu zhes bya ba la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @398a *//

analyzed: pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /

original: kun dga' bo /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas me tog gtor ba zhes bya ba de dag gi dge slong gi dge 'dun yang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtshungs par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: tshe'i tshad kyang lo stong du mtshungs par 'gyur ro //

original: de dag gang dang gang nas mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing mngon par byung nas rab tu 'byung ba dang / gang dang gang du rab tu byung ste gnas par 'gyur ba de dang de dag tu me tog kha dog lnga pa'i char dag kyang rab tu 'bab par 'gyur ro //

translated: And wherever they emerge from homelessness, and having emerged, go forth, and wherever they go forth and remain, there flowers of five colors will rain down.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de lta bas na /

original: kun dga' bo /

original: kun dga' bo /
